wikipedia_page.main: William Luff (1872–1960) was a British actor and cinematographer. He played the role of Charles II in the 1922 silent The Glorious Adventure. Following the arrival of sound he switched to cinematography. He worked for Julius Hagen's Twickenham Studios during the 1930s, shooting several of the company's more expensive films.
